function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Extended working hours and prolonged occupant presence in buildings can increase infection risk","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uniform population distribution pattern can reduce the number of infected people by up to 56%","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Optimal population distribution pattern in terms of energy consumption can reduce energy consumption by up to 32%","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increasing ventilation rate in buildings reduces the number of infected people but increases hvac energy consumption","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reducing class duration may result in a reduction of 49.6% in the number of infected people with covid-19.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reducing class duration results in a 28% and 28.6% reduction in energy consumption in winter and summer, respectively.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The study identifies the impact of occupants, air exchange rate, class duration, and working hours on energy consumption and covid-19 infection risk.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased population density due to longer working hours may lead to higher risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extension of class duration may result in prolonged exposure time and higher risk of virus transmission.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extended exposure time in spaces with infected people increases the risk of infection, despite virus particles deactivating over time.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extending working hours of university buildings increases hvac energy consumption and occupant presence, impacting covid-19 transmission.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased air exchange rate may lead to higher energy consumption in the building.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher air exchange rate may lead to decreased risk of virus transmission and infection.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of occupant distribution on covid-19 transmission","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Affect of air exchange rate on energy consumption and virus transmission","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High number of infected people in the building","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low energy consumption patterns leading to specific occupancy levels","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation due to hvac system malfunction or inefficiency","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus quanta concentration increases with occupant density, leading to higher infection risk and more newly infected people.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exponential relationship between quanta concentration and time, leading to higher virus particles with increased occupant density.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of infection increases with greater exposure to others and higher occupant density in the building.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Release of virus particles into the air due to inhalation and exhalation","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Settling rate of virus particles on the ground","category":"Soil","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inactivation rate of the virus in the environment","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption by hvac systems due to occupant density and variations in climate conditions","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate hvac system settings potentially contributing to disease transmission","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High occupancy density in classes and the building, leading to increased risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding due to maximum number of occupants constraints","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient building orientation for solar energy utilization","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in virus quanta emission rate","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumptions about virus settlement and inactivation rates","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Calculation of floating virus particles in the room","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exponential increase of newly infected people over time in confined spaces","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate thermal comfort conditions leading to occupant discomfort","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of optimization algorithm in building occupant distribution","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Airborne virus transmission in confined spaces","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate hvac operation in the built environment","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate occupant presence modeling in confined spaces","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in occupant density leads to a higher risk of virus transmission in buildings","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupant behavior has a significant impact on energy consumption in buildings","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Architectural design parameters, indoor moisture content, temperature, and lighting level can impact microbial survivability in buildings","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High population density in buildings increases the risk of virus transmission through inhalation, exhalation, and direct contact with infected objects.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High energy consumption in hvac systems","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High-risk environmental exposures and inaccessibility of accurate information and timely healthcare services","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate infection control benefits from uv lamps and hepa filtration","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of uvgi systems as a substitute for hepa filters in isolation rooms","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low humidity affecting uvgi system effectiveness","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardized testing for uvgi effectiveness","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of uvgi systems in real-world conditions","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential sensitivity of bacteria in deionized water to uvgi compared to bacteria in droplet nuclei","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"}]}
